org.apache.juneau.collections

Class AMap<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • java.util.HashMap<K,V>
        • java.util.LinkedHashMap<K,V>
          • org.apache.juneau.collections.AMap<K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - The key type.
    V - The value type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Map<K,V>

    public final class AMap<K,V>
extends LinkedHashMap<K,V>
    A fluent LinkedHashMap.

    Provides various convenience methods for creating and populating a map with minimal code.

    Examples:

    // A map of string key/value pairs. AMap<String,String> m = AMap.of("foo","bar"); // Append to map. m.a("baz", "qux"); // Create an unmodifiable view of this list. Map<String,String> m2 = m.unmodifiable(); // Convert to simplified JSON. String json = m.asString(); // Convert to XML. String json = m.asString(XmlSerializer.DEFAULT);

    See Also:
    Serialized Form
